item.title: SublimeREPL require global modules in javascript (node)
item.description:
When using SublimeREPL I was having problems using globally installed node modules. For example I installed ramda globally using npm:

npm install -g ramda

When trying to use ramda in the SublimeREPL I was getting the following error:

> var _ = require('ramda');
Error: Cannot find module 'ramda'  
    at Function.Module.
item.dc:creator: Justin Ramel
item.content:encoded:
When using SublimeREPL I was having problems using globally installed node modules. For example I installed ramda globally using npm:

npm install -g ramda

When trying to use ramda in the SublimeREPL I was getting the following error:

> var _ = require('ramda');
Error: Cannot find module 'ramda'  
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:336:15)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:278:25)
    at Module.require (module.js:365:17)
    at require (module.js:384:17)
    at repl:1:9
    at REPLServer.defaultEval (repl.js:132:27)
    at bound (domain.js:254:14)
    at REPLServer.runBound [as eval] (domain.js:267:12)
    at REPLServer.<anonymous> (repl.js:279:12)
    at REPLServer.emit (events.js:107:17)

Seems SublimeREPL was not picking up my NODE_PATH environment settings. You can tell SublimeREPL exactly which environment settings to use in the user settings. Open the settings via the menu Preferences > Package Settings > SublimeREPL > Settings - User

{
  "default_extend_env": {
    "NODE_PATH": "{NODE_PATH}:/usr/local/lib/node_modules"
    }
}

Here I am setting the NODE_PATH to be whatever the current NODE_PATH is plus the specific directory /usr/local/lib/node_modules your path may be different.

item.title: SublimeREPL getting the javascript (node) repl working
item.description:
When first running the node repl in SublimeREPL I was getting the error stringToWrite must be a string:

readline.js:220  
    throw new TypeError('stringToWrite must be a string');
          ^
TypeError: stringToWrite must be a string  
    at REPLServer._writeToOutput (readline.js:220:11)
    at REPLServer.Interface.prompt (readline.js:188:10)
item.dc:creator: Justin Ramel
item.content:encoded:
When first running the node repl in SublimeREPL I was getting the error stringToWrite must be a string:

readline.js:220  
    throw new TypeError('stringToWrite must be a string');
          ^
TypeError: stringToWrite must be a string  
    at REPLServer._writeToOutput (readline.js:220:11)
    at REPLServer.Interface.prompt (readline.js:188:10)
    at REPLServer.displayPrompt (repl.js:400:8)
    at new REPLServer (repl.js:330:8)
    at Object.exports.start (repl.js:339:14)
    at /home/njr11/.config/sublime-text-3/Packages/SublimeREPL/config/NodeJS/repl.js:5:20
    at Object.<anonymous> (/home/njr11/.config/sublime-text-3/Packages/SublimeREPL/config/NodeJS/repl.js:38:3)
    at Module._compile (module.js:460:26)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:478:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:355:32)

***Repl Closed***

To fix this I had to change the repl config file for node in the SublimeREPL config folder.

Open the packages folder via Sublime menu Preferences > Browse Packages...

From this folder navigate to SublimeREPL/config/NodeJS/ and edit the file repl.js:

    var rep = repl.start({
        prompt:    null, //'> ',
        source:    null, //process.stdin,
        eval:      null, //require('vm').runInThisContext,
        useGlobal: true, //false
        useColors: false
    });

I simply changed the prompt setting from prompt: null, //'> ', to prompt: '> '.

    var rep = repl.start({
        prompt:    '> ',
        source:    null, //process.stdin,
        eval:      null, //require('vm').runInThisContext,
        useGlobal: true, //false
        useColors: false
    });
